New Records: Gavin Lux hit his first home run off a left-handed pitcher in 25 months.
Key Match Events: Gavin Lux homered and had a sacrifice fly.
Mookie Betts hit a first-inning homer.
Shohei Ohtani and Mookie Betts expanded the lead to 3-0 in the second inning.
Will Smith hit a 432-foot home run.
Tommy Edman executed a squeeze bunt up the first-base line.
Eight Dodgers relievers combined to shut out the Padres.
Pre-Game Insights: Freddie Freeman and manager Dave Roberts discussed Freeman's injuries and the decision not to play him in Game 4.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts expressed excitement about Game 5 and praised the team's resilience.
Kiké Hernández highlighted the team's capability despite injuries.
Will Smith emphasized the team's collective effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' 8-0 victory in Game 4 forced a winner-take-all Game 5.
The Dodgers' bottom half of the lineup significantly contributed despite previous struggles.
Dylan Cease was chased after just 38 pitches, working on short rest for the first time in his career.
